etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in American Journal Pharmacy. From crypto- + op- + -ine, probably after German Kryptopin, †Cryptopin, itself after English cryptopia

definitions: A crystalline alkaloid present in opium and in certain plants of the family Fumariaceae.

notes.text: Cryptopine has a tetracyclic structure. Formula: C₂₁H₂₃NO₅.
